001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.StaticFactory;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
011import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
012import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.TrainableFunction;
013
014import java.util.List;
015
016/**
017 * A {@link Regime} decorator that wraps another training regime and reports the
018 * objective (loss) value at each epoch.
019 * <p>
020 * This class is typically used for debugging or monitoring: it computes the
021 * aggregated loss before the first epoch (baseline) and after each epoch, then
022 * prints the results if {@code dump} is enabled. It also tracks the relative
023 * improvement between epochs.
024 * </p>
025 * <h3>Improvement Sign Convention</h3>
026 * The reported relative improvement is expressed as a percentage change in
027 * loss compared to the previous epoch:
028 * <ul>
029 *   <li>A negative value means the loss decreased (improved).</li>
030 *   <li>A positive value means the loss increased (worsened).</li>
031 * </ul>
032 * <h3>Thread Safety</h3>
033 * This class is not thread-safe. Create a new instance per training run or call
034 * {@link #reset()} if you want to reuse the same instance across runs.
035 *
036 * @see DelegatedRegime
037 */
038@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
039public class ObjectiveReportingRegime extends DelegatedRegime {
040
041    /**
042     * The hyperparameter name to dump the objective
043     */
044    public static final String HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP = "objectiveDump";
045
046    private Number improvement;
047    private Number currentLoss;
048
049    /**
050     * Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
051     *
052     * @param regime the underlying training regime to delegate to
053     */
054    @StaticFactory
055    public static <N extends Number> ObjectiveReportingRegime create(Regime regime) {
056        return new ObjectiveReportingRegime(regime, false);
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
061     *
062     * @param regime the underlying training regime to delegate to
063     * @param dump   whether to print loss values and improvement at each epoch
064     */
065    public ObjectiveReportingRegime(Regime regime, boolean dump) {
066        super(regime);
067        setHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, dump);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Returns whether this regime is currently printing loss values.
072     *
073     * @return {@code true} if reporting is enabled, {@code false} otherwise
074     */
075    public boolean isDumpingLossValues() {
076        return getHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, Boolean.class);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Enables or disables reporting of loss values.
081     *
082     * @param dump {@code true} to enable reporting, {@code false} to disable
083     */
084    public void setDumpingLossValues(boolean dump) {
085        setHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, dump);
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Trains the given estimation function using the wrapped regime and reports
090     * the aggregated loss before and after training.
091     * <p>
092     * On the first epoch, the baseline aggregated loss is computed before any
093     * updates. After each epoch, the new aggregated loss is computed, the
094     * relative improvement is calculated, and results are printed if reporting
095     * is enabled.
096     * </p>
097     *
098     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
099     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
100     * @param objective          the loss function to evaluate
101     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to update parameters
102     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
103     */
104    public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer) {
105        train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) null);
106    }
107
108    public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, int step) {
109        train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, (Integer) step);
110    }
111
112    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
113    private <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, Integer step) {
114        JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport = estimationFunction.getNumberTypeSupport();
115        N previousLoss;
116        if (objective != null && step == 1) {
117            List<Pair<Array<N>, Array<N>>> batch = trainingSet.samples().stream().map(s -> Pair.of(estimationFunction.estimate(s.features()), s.targetOutputs())).toList();
118            previousLoss = objective.calculateLoss(batch, estimationFunction.getParameters());
119            if (isDumpingLossValues()) {
120                System.out.printf("[Measurement %4d] Aggregated loss = %.4s (baseline)%n", 0, previousLoss);
121            }
122        } else {
123            previousLoss = (N) currentLoss;
124        }
125        if (step == null) {
126            regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
127        } else {
128            regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer, step);
129        }
130        if (objective != null) {
131            List<Pair<Array<N>, Array<N>>> batch = trainingSet.samples().stream().map(s -> Pair.of(estimationFunction.estimate(s.features()), s.targetOutputs())).toList();
132            currentLoss = objective.calculateLoss(batch, estimationFunction.getParameters());
133            improvement = typeSupport.multiply(typeSupport.divide(typeSupport.subtract(previousLoss, (N) currentLoss), previousLoss), -100);
134            if (isDumpingLossValues()) {
135                System.out.printf("[Measurement %4d] Aggregated loss = %.4s (%.2s%%)%n", step, currentLoss, improvement);
136            }
137        }
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Returns the relative improvement in aggregated loss compared to the
142     * previous epoch.
143     * <p>
144     * For example, if epoch N yields a loss of 10 and epoch N+1 yields a loss
145     * of 5, this method returns -50.0f. If the loss increases, the returned
146     * value will be positive.
147     * </p>
148     *
149     * @return the relative improvement percentage, or {@code null} if no
150     * training has happened yet
151     */
152    public Number getRelativeImprovement() {
153        return improvement;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Returns the aggregated loss from the most recent epoch.
158     *
159     * @return the last aggregated loss value, or {@code null} if no training
160     * has happened yet
161     */
162    public Number getCurrentLoss() {
163        return currentLoss;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Resets this reporting regime so it can be reused for a new training runs.
168     * This clears the iteration count, current loss, and improvement history.
169     */
170    public void reset() {
171        this.currentLoss = null;
172        this.improvement = null;
173    }
174}
